page.title: 16The Canal in Hungerford.
page.content: One of the delights of Hungerford is a walk along the canal on a Summer's evening. To moor a boat at Hungerford costs Â£100 per year compared with Â£200 at Newbury, this is because the entire length of the canal, the Kennet and Avon, is not navigable. Indeed at Hungerford only one boat per month can be seen on the canal. There are plans for the canal to be entirely navigable from Reading to Bristol by 1989 .They had a narrow boat known as "The Rose Of Hungerford" specially built in 1983 and she runs from Hungerford wharf to Dunmill lock throughout the summer offering trips to members of the public . There are 4 locks on the Hungerford stretch. These are approximately 5 metres deep.
